alert.note: Alert for Athens; Morgan; Perry (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:29AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Perry, western Morgan and northwestern Athens Counties through 200 AM EDT... At 128 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of New Lexington to near Logan. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Nelsonville, New Lexington, Glouster, McConnelsville, Shawnee, Perry State Forest, Crooksville, Chauncey, Junction City, New Straitsville, Malta, Corning, Buchtel, Stockport, Jacksonville, Murray City, Trimble, Hemlock, Rendville and Burr Oak State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
